intro: Terminalia orbicularis, commonly known as the round-leaved terminalia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its distinctive round or orbicular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by small, round fruits. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their purported health benefits. Terminalia orbicularis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverine areas.
